title: ‘I think my over all experience is very good with Deloitte.’
pros: Working with Deliotte is real a life time experience. The business processes in the Deliotte is well defined and every thing is streamlined.
cons: I believe challenges are the ways through which you learn new things. I think the most challenging thing i face in Deloitte is the time constraint for the project.

title: ‘Under rated learning environment with sometimes under valued employees and high expectations, making for great employees once run through the Deloitte ecosystem’
pros: People, learning, diverse industry and solutions and career development
cons: Low salary and long hoirs

title: ‘Good place to grown until you are harvested for commerce’
pros: Incredibly flexible work arrangements, generous leave entitlements, inspired female colleges
cons: Remuneration and career progression/learning - left to take AP job at ASX2000 security company for better pay and learning opportunities

title: ‘All the perks and exposure of a big consulting firm, with a management team committed to professional growth not seen at any other big firm.’
pros: Amazing environment to be a part of, especially for graduates beginning their career. The exposure to such a working environment early on in a graduates career really ingrains the importance of organisational culture to both productivity as well as professional development .
cons: A challenge that exists, and exists with each of the 'big six', is the ability to promote the pathways for career advancement beyond their own functional areas. As most of us develop into our careers, we alone understand and seek out our own pathway, but for graduates and those that are young in their careers, the vision of advancement tends to cease at the top of their own 'functions', rather than outside into new areas. Of course, there is a risk of losing 'top talent' by promoting pathways outside designated functions, but perhaps a communication strategy can be developed for a happy medium.

title: ‘A workplace where you are constantly challanged to become your best and differentiate yourself from the rest’
pros: Great oppurtunities to learn from leaders in the field and the ability to work in different service lines. Deloitte also offers endless training sessions to build on all the skills necessary to become a true professional.
cons: Some challanges include workload whereby you are given the oppurtunity to do the work of someone at a higher level which proves to be challenging but very rewarding. If the work becomes too much you can always revert back to your original role.

title: ‘Every day got a little bit worse in this toxic work culture’
pros: Energetic juniors, willing to learn
cons: Partners acting to protect their patch. Partners not listening. Preference to 'yes men', rather than listening to clients

title: ‘Below average - enter at own risk’
pros: The staff are fairly ok until you're not in the clicks. But you do make friends. Making great relationships with clients was easier than making friends here.
cons: Everything.... Management, pay disparage, opportunities, long hours...

title: ‘The Cloud Team are a joke - dont go there.’
pros: Interesting work. Good team to work with.
cons: The sales team are not engaged with the delivery team. Scope is never correct.  Poor project management.   Management are poor.

title: ‘I have never worked so long, or so hard, and been so engaged before! However, you must know why you are there to cope with the demand and make sure you are getting an adequate return on your investment of time and energy!’
pros: If you are looking to be challenged, have exposure to a broad range of projects and using your skills in different ways, Deloitte will deliver! Along with a great brand to be associated with, great people and the ability to stay in touch with what is hot right now!
cons: The hours are long and you sometimes feel like you have spent hours just refining the presentation of your message. Expectations increase over time and especially with promotion as the KPIs are still a real focus and you have to spend a lot of time out of hours to achieve the business development hours and sales on top of project delivery. No extra pay or incentives are provided in return.

title: ‘It’s good company to work with but lot of rooms for improvements specially when it’s about work culture’
pros: Good culture , better plans for future, big brand name and broad thinking for a company as a whole
cons: Internal management at various team levels are not consistent and not monitored .

title: ‘I hated it.’
pros: Work life balance was great, this was always necessary because the type of work you do can be very stressful
cons: The kinds of projects can be challenging and not the kind of work i enjoy.  A lot of the work was document jocky work with no real thoughts required

title: ‘Never the smartest person in the room and always challenged and encouraged to bring your best.’
pros: Great culture, innovative, global exposure, great brand and strong market eminence. The best thing about Deloitte is the empower and trust culture and the ability to own work and work autonomously.
cons: In some cases the amount of processes can be a hindrance.

title: ‘Only interested in the money - billing clients’
pros: Nice offices, good social functions
cons:
Only focus on staff who make them money and you have to almost beg to get basic working tools
Very hierarchic .... no one is better than anyone else..except Deloitte where the partners think they are better than anyone else..such egos!

title: ‘Life at Deloitte’
pros: Interesting work. Great people.
cons: Lack of bonus and other financial incentives while long hours and stretch targets are often the norm.

title: ‘The brand name was not really worth it.’
pros: The challenges and that's about it
cons: Management and reward for hard work. Negotiation to wage is like asking for fire to burn under water.

title: ‘Worthwhile but not a long term proposition’
pros: Exposure to high quality clients and methodology
cons: Too much focused on utilisation; generally management not great

title: ‘A great and varied place to work that rewards employees.’
pros: Good culture, good remuneration, opportunities for development.
cons: The challenge for me was that the work was too intermittent (as I worked in an area that focused on transactions) and as such did not have much to do with how good Deloitte was

title: ‘Good supportive company to work for overall’
pros: Flexibility and mobility
cons: Poor benefits and perks

title: ‘Really bad’
pros: Nothing was good at the workplace
cons: Poor culture and lack of professionalism

title: ‘An amazing place to work culturally and develop skills ’
pros: The culture is fantastic and the best I have experienced
cons: Salary & career progression

title: ‘Good to start your career ’
pros: Good work life balance, great training opportunities. Good and supportive team
cons: Salary not at par with industry standards. No bonus.

title: ‘Good place to start accounting career.’
pros: Opportunity to grow in the profession. Learn a lot.
cons: Long work hours at work.

title: ‘Deloitte was my best employer’
pros: Very vibrant atmosphere, packed of talented people in many disciplinary, big projects, exposure to recognisable brands and clients
cons: Client expectation is high

title: ‘A dynamic environment for those who like fast paced work’
pros: Culture
cons: Work life balance

title: ‘Love it, would recommend it to my own mother’
pros: Challenging projects
cons: Clients expectations

title: ‘Great Experience, would recommend to anyone who wants to challenge themselves and push their career’
pros:
Great environment with smart motivated people. 
Focused on personal and career development.
cons: Very high expectation environment, not everyone will feel comfortable in the role

title: ‘An ok place to work’
pros: Exposure to a lot of different clients
cons: Growth within service lines is challenging

title: ‘Good experience, and you can learn a lot of IT and healthy insurance knowledege’
pros: Very challenge, but equal opportunity.
cons: Sometimes you have to work extra

title: ‘Great times, lots of work and very satisfied clients’
pros: People and experiences
cons: Expectations and intensity

title: ‘A heirachial pyramid structure where they are only interested in revenue - sales and utilisation - very little interest in cusomer’
pros: External people still value the brand
cons: Old school partners who have never actually done it. A kindergarten for grads with massive turnover - do not care about people just money

title: ‘Good to have the name on resume.’
pros: Opportunity to work on large engagements.
cons: Plenty of office politics, tough to survive if trash talk is not a skill you hone.

title: ‘Join if you want to experience major changes that frustrates you yearly ’
pros:
Friendly people
Nice office view
cons:
The benefit/remuneration is hopeless...
Totally unable to retain talent at all...
Want work-life balance? Forget it... 
Dog-eat-dog kind of environment
Management cares about their own pocket more than anything

title: ‘Worked with amazing and inspiring people.’
pros: Working with incredibly smart people
cons: Difficult to influence change in the organisation

title: ‘Enjoyable environment with lots of opportunities.’
pros: Positive atmosphere, flexible work arrangements.
cons: Surprisingly low degree of office automation.

title: ‘Worst place I have ever worked in with really few interesting engagements.’
pros: Office is OK and will provide you with good tools to work.
cons: Very bad culture and really poor management in some departments/clusters. High turnover, no consideration at all for employees.
location: Sydney, Nouvelle Galles du Sud, Australie

title: ‘Great place to start career’
pros: Brand, dynamic, changing, multiple opportunities
cons: Too much work. Always short on staff. No bonuses. Timesheets

title: ‘Good learning experience’
pros: The people, study support, challenging, steady career path
cons: Not enough pay for what is expected

title: ‘Good experience for a period of 2-3 years.’
pros: Open and clear communication
cons: Too much travelling and quite a few times able to work outside your expertise area

title: ‘All about clients perception’
pros: Flexible hours
cons: Not getting rewarded

title: ‘Great to lay a strong foundation’
pros: Interesting and diverse work experience
cons: Work life balance and salary

title: ‘Great to lay a strong foundation’
pros: Interesting and diverse work experience
cons: Work life balance and salary

title: ‘Better than other companies but not the best... slowly getting there though’
pros: Changes constantly to try to make this better
cons: No voice if things change or happen it comes from above

title: ‘A challenging place to work that suits only the most driven people, with a culture that is sometimes at odds with its values. ’
pros: Diversity of projects and industry exposure.
cons: Political culture. Perceptions of work life balance at odds with performance measures.

title: ‘Met some great people, but didn't get the opportunities to grow’
pros: Some great partners. Good vibe amongs colleagues. Easy access from public transport.
cons: Lack of training. No support on some jobs, and some managers being inexperienced didn't know how to deal with normal problems encountered in consulting

title: ‘Long hours, shocking pay, but make some friends for life because of it.’
pros: Lots of work to be involved in, opportunity to meet good people
cons: You are just a number, work hard for nothing, no purpose except lining the partners pockets

title: ‘Great but could be better’
pros: Opportunities to know different people from different companies
cons: Hardly able to do what you like.

title: ‘Good development ’
pros: Culture and environment
cons: Each team is unique

title: ‘Overworked but cared for.’
pros: The company treates you well, they genuinely care about what you learn and take care of you.
cons: Too many hours, unfair work life balance and bad ratings without reasonable explanations.

title: ‘Average’
pros: Work location and environment
cons: Work process and procedures not well defined. No proper project planning. Limited staff communication. Unfair work practices.

title: ‘A pleasant place to work.’
pros: Friendly and exciting working environment, good place to learn new things.
cons: Not enough research positions for the post-graduated researchers.

title: ‘Supported and encouraged to progress.’
pros: Opportunity to progress career rapidly.
cons: Working autonomously quite early on. Management are sometimes preoccupied with their own agendas.

title: ‘Priceless’
pros: Great mentors,  and opportunities for anyone willing to seize them.
cons: Pressure on fees and for growth.

title: ‘Nice to have the Brand name on your resume. Thats all !’
pros: Overall ambiance of office.
cons:
Its just another consulting firm. You never know when the partner is going to resign !

Also, the culture kind of gave importance to individual than a collective team growth.

title: ‘Learning experience ’
pros: Great exposure to a number of technologies
cons: Work and social culture needs to improve

title: ‘There to get the job done.’
pros: Very big company with massive reputation and brand
cons: Unable to be innovative and different.

title: ‘Hard work / is not recognised but just expected’
pros: Worklife balance , breakfast/fruits provided everyday
cons: No support /limited training for admin staff / long term staff get away with almost everything
location: Brisbane, Division of Brisbane QLD, Australia

title: ‘Wonderful. Tremendous learning opportunities with great peers.’
pros: Work culture, people
cons: Work-life balance. Lots of work.

title: ‘Delotte: nothing special’
pros: Diversity and equal opportunity
cons: If you don't lure yourself to the people who have power, you're not valued no matter how good/professional you are

title: ‘Great learning curve plus good on the resume’
pros: The People is the best part of the job
cons: The Pay is very poor.

title: ‘It's like you start at a fantastic new organisation at each new engagement and don't want to leave.’
pros: Culture and breadth of opportunities and client experiences
cons: Working hours and balancing the challenges of home life

title: ‘If you can go to other big 4, try them first ’
pros: Opportunities to grow
cons: Toxic culture, unclear promotion guidelines, biased treatment

title: ‘Emphasis on Graduate sector and missing the mark on mature workforce’
pros:
Collaboration 
  Perhaps not enough credit to mature workforce
cons: Too focussed on Graduates

title: ‘Overall very positive’
pros: Culture is really positive and mainly supportive.
cons: Churning clients to meet KPI's

title: ‘Great place to develop!’
pros: Endless opportunities and great company culture in A&A.
cons: Too many opportunities  and very long hours. Work life balance is difficult

title: ‘An enjoyable experience to have while I'm young and willing to challenge myself’
pros: The culture of the firm
cons: Low pay, tough working hours

title: ‘Great for the resume, seek out opportunities to expand your experience and then move’
pros: Great colleagues, exposure to good projects, a well known brand to have on your resume
cons: Some well respected partners in the firm although a large proportion who are more interested in their pay packet than the work or developing the capabilities of others

title: ‘The best kick start to you career’
pros: Career growth and development
cons: Risk of burn-out and low salary when compared to industry based roles

title: ‘Once in a lifetime experience’
pros: The best place to enjoy work and food.
cons: No challenges. The company arranges sessions for career growth.

title: ‘Awesome experience’
pros: Opportunities for career development
cons: Challenges are only for those who dont like Client facing role

title: ‘Great diversity in the type of work’
pros: Great team and great Partners
cons: Managing multiple client commitments

title: ‘Challenging but amazing for personal growth.’
pros: Some clients, learning, smart passionate people
cons: Pace, balance, some clients

title: ‘Interesting’
pros: Diversity , amenities, environment
cons: Opportunity, career progression

title: ‘Fantastic job, I wish I never left..’
pros: Great environment, working with the equipment I love
cons: 1 person trying to run a national environment

title: ‘It was horrible. Eight months i will never get back. Do not work here. ’
pros: High pressure work experience
cons: Work life balance. There was none.

title: ‘Deloitte is a great team environment’
pros:
The team environment
Flexibility to work from home when required
cons:
Personal development
Salary

title: ‘My tenure at Deloitte gave me al lround good experience that is a good addition to my vast accounting experinence that i already possess.’
pros: A world brand therefore a good addition to your resume
cons: Survival if you aren't a mate for few who can influence. The staff turn over seems to be little high.

title: ‘It is a mix of pros and cons’
pros: Some opportunities to learn from different engagements and there are some good people around which made the working environment enjoyable
cons: Favouritism which limits opportunities for career development

title: ‘A great place to develop and grow and gain valuable experience’
pros: Working on exciting projects for big Australian companies. This exposure in conjunction with working with great people really helps me to grow too.
cons: Sometimes the projects are busy and quite demanding.

title: ‘Wasn’t what was described, slow and stagnant. Management are realistic and aware of employee wants. Communication and engagement is poor, leaving teams disengaged. No incentive plans or recognition.’
pros: Brand name, reputation and delivery to clients is strong for the market.
cons: Passively political, slow in making decisions and lacks organization and lacks in employee engagement and empowerment.

title: ‘Supportive people. Great work!’
pros: The people and work. It is fun, everyone is doing interesting work, people talk to you if you are new. The Canberra team is growing fast, there is lots of work which means there are lots of opportunities to development your career. I can work from home if I have to which means I can balance work and family.
cons: Technology occasionally - the system can't keep up on the odd day.

title: ‘Constantly anxious’
pros: Friendly staff, free breakfast, office yoga sessions, the ability to learn how an office services role eotkd.
cons: The whole job was a challenge. No matter how hard you try it was never good enough. If you're an introvert then look for a different company as they don't understand how they work.

title: ‘It's ok but better to spend your working life somewhere else’
pros: Nice offices, plenty of training, flexible working arrangements
cons: Low pay, minimal possibilities for career progression. This is best suited for graduates out of uni and make a career at the company but lateral hires will have to wait ages to get their skills recognised, have a promotion or get a raise.

title: ‘Great for young talent, not so much for experienced hires’
pros: Good brand to have under your belt. A lot of young talent - their graduate program is the main wait in, and some graduates end up building a solid career with the firm.
cons: Not really a good place for lateral industry hires. Lack of bonus incentives and performance reviews heavily focused on utilisation and revenue. Despite the global presence, there is very little opportunity to work with international teams. No real sense of a team when you are stuck on a client site on your own. No real support for senior career development - you're expected to come in and drive your own sales, generate your own pipeline, manage your own accounts, even if you're not interested in sales or account management.

title: ‘Leaderships complete lack of respect for support staff, greedy, cost cutting.’
pros: Fantastic fellow staff to work with, large enough place to find other opportunities
cons: Culture over the last 2 years is terrible, since the new CEO and his ELT came on board, genuine focus on 'people' has dissapeared. Complete lack of respect for support staff, greedy, cost cutting. Partners think they are better than everyone else.

title: ‘Consulting at Deloitte is a roller coaster. I like roller coasters. ’
pros:
If you are willing to put in the work the sky is the limit
Great people, great culture
Shapes you to be a competent employee
cons:
Long hours
Lack of focused career development 
The project will always get done but a few people may get chewed up in the process

title: ‘Just don't’
pros: Not much. Worst place I have ever worked
cons: Short staffed, unrealistic budgets

title: ‘I do enjoy working here any way.’
pros: Nice colleages and flexibility.
cons: It might be due to its size, not really organized.

title: ‘Live it and love it and you'll succeed’
pros: Make things happen in a timely manner. Love and value new ifeas
cons: Volume and pace so much happening sometimes need to manage time and prioritise accordingly

title: ‘One of the worst places I have ever worked.’
pros: I failed to find anything good or worthwhile about my experience at Deloitte.
cons: Management does not listen to your issues. Worklife balance simply doesn't exist, if you do not want to travel or do not want a particular assignment then you are threatened with job security.

title: ‘Good for base of career but that's it’
pros:
Young crowd here
Teamwork 
Learn great base accounting skills
Get to work on a variety of businesses
cons:
No future
Accounting Professional services is a commodity

title: ‘Could have been better.’
pros: Brand of company on CV
cons: Senior management, remuneration, diversity.

title: ‘My experience so far has been the greatest of my career to date and the level of integrity and motivation and the feeling that I am valued is unsurpassed.’
pros: Our values and vision- our collaboration between people is fantastic
cons: The only challenge I face is personally wanting to upskill because I am inspired by the talent that surrounds me

title: ‘Very challenging and fulfilling experience’
pros: Management, Work Culture
cons: Work Life balance

title: ‘No work life balance!’
pros: The opportunity to develop meaningful relationships.
cons: Management are not always aware what is happening in the levels below them and not trying to understand either. They let their biases cloud their judgement rather than really understand.

title: ‘A bit disappointing ’
pros: Brand name for future opportunities
cons: Career opportunities

title: ‘Travelling long term for projects ruin you ’
pros: Lots of projects but no choice of which you get to be on
cons: Got told that travelling to other states to billable is ruining my promotion chances, didn’t help that they forced me into another long term interstate project

title: ‘Corporate ladder climbers will thrive.’
pros: Office location, global brand, onboarding and support.
cons: Encouraged an \"Aim to be famous\" culture, which ultimately encouraged stepping on colleagues for a chance at 15 seconds of fame.

title: ‘One of the better big 4 companies to work for’
pros: Good parental support and options for mothers back to work
cons: Upper management roles are very sales focused which does not suit everyone

title: ‘Great Corporate with excellent career opportunities.’
pros:
Flexibility & work life balance.
Career opportunities.
Working environment. All inclusive.
cons: Whilst flexible, expectations are long working hours.

title: ‘Very good! ’
pros: Good initiatives and they aim to look after their people and ensure you are happy.
cons: None really.. alot of new systems to learn.

title: ‘Diverse’
pros: Great experience with the largest clients and software available on the market
cons: Long working hours and low salary

title: ‘Great people to work with.’
pros: Nice people, friendly understanding management. Great office space
cons: I had none as I was only employed as a fill-in while other receptionists were ill.

title: ‘Disappointing, not reflective of the Deloitte brand overall’
pros: Excellent office fitout, and some fantastic people within the different teams. Partnership team were absolutely lovely.
cons: The actions of a few unfortunately positioned individuals affected the entire office environment, and promoted a micromanagement culture.

title: ‘A challenging role with plenty of benefits’
pros: Opportunities to work with huge clients. Great name for your resume. Good team and friendly partners
cons: The work is HARD. If you want to get out by 5pm, you have to hustle to get everything done. This is the most mentally draining role I've had

title: ‘It was a great opportunity and experience working with Deloitte.’
pros: Great for career development especially for those staring their careers in finance.
cons: Working on tight deadlines and sometimes limited resources.

title: ‘An enlightening experience’
pros: The Analysts and Senior Analysts were enthusiatic and keen to learn.
cons: The competition between business units and individuals to ensure that their numbers were good drove particular behaviours that put the customer last. Directors were encouraged to treat other staff poorly.

title: ‘The office is very good for new starters / grads. Lateral hires do face a lot of challenges as expectations are very high. The high expectations need to be commensurate with the benefits as well which is not the case. There is a lot of pressure to get thr’
pros: Very diverse options for choosing your line of work.
cons: Perfection is demanded which can be hard to do on a consistent basis. You are expected to manage  Alot of on-the-job training plus engagement managements as well as technical deliverables. While you do learn a lot, mentally it does drain you.

title: ‘Great learning environment with exciting challenges’
pros: Opportunities, training available, career enhancement
cons: Long hours, trying to maintain a work/life balance

title: ‘The best workplace in the world’
pros: Very friendly working environment and supportive management to staff career development.
cons: Always work under pressure to meet targets but very rewarding for personal development

title: ‘Deloitte is such a company that every professional must work for for some time in their careers. It teaches you a lots of things, makes you more ambitious and makes you strive higher goals.’
pros: Opportunities to learn and advance your career, inspiring colleagues.
cons: Work pressure and competition is high in many areas.

title: ‘Amazing graduate program’
pros: Set you up with the core competencies required for a strong career in accounting; adds gravitas to your CV; fantastic graduate program (an amazing experience)
cons: Salary is very low; they justify this based on the fact they pay for your CA; you will earn much more in market - do your time here though for the brand on your CV

title: ‘Great Place to work for....’
pros: Good People, Good Brand, Good Projects
cons: Work-life Balance

title: ‘For technologist, Think your priorities before you jump in.’
pros: Access to resources, Consulting techniques and methods, CXO focused consulting opportunities
cons:
No team culture, No good for technology folks as mostly recruited
For tactical requirements , technology career path is limited, No or limited mentorships
Or support to grow in new areas

title: ‘Smart people but cut throat culture’
pros: Smart people who are interested in doing interesting things things with and for clients
cons: Cut throat culture, push people down to get to the top. Financial metrics are all that matter

title: ‘Best time I had at work’
pros: Very good organization to work. Lot of growth opportunities
cons: Moving to different departments

title: ‘Good for starting a career and suitable for people who are prone to challenges’
pros:
Variety of projects,
Learning material & trainings,
Latest innovative ideas,
Like- minded people
cons:
Long work hours,
Pressure,
Constant learning requirement

title: ‘Develop enough to leave on top.’
pros: Exposure to variety of work, professional development, quality of resources available.
cons: Work life balance can be nonexistent, your area of the business may be disadvantaged to support a deal for another area of the business.

title: ‘Below average - compared to other Big 4.’
pros: Fairly innovative. Some fresh thinking. Energetic colleagues.
cons: Poor leadership. Average management capability. Archaic systems.

title: ‘Met some amazing people’
pros: The cultural diversity, the inspiring women program, making lifelong friends.
cons: The hours were sometimes a challenge

title: ‘It is not a good place to work for people who have lots of Australian experience’
pros: A good place for new graduated students.
cons: Working with lack of experience people with no background of Australia project and Australian culture. The company has no future vision how to become a good Australian SAP Consulting company

title: ‘Great, supprotive and fun company’
pros: Equal opportunity and career development are acknowledged well and there is a great understanding of family-work life balance
cons: Some of the IT infrastructure could be more up to date

title: ‘You can make of it what you want, it is limited only by the Partnership’
pros: Diversity of talented individuals you could work.  If you are lucky, you really will be able to make lifelong friends.
cons: Budget - constantly limited in our push to grow the business as Partnership profits needed to be sustained at certain levels.

title: ‘Great company, hard work but well worth it’
pros: Highly motivated people, exciting work, great place to work
cons: High expectations and pressure at times, can be put into difficult situations when partnered with lower performing team members

title: ‘Keeping you focused and challenged’
pros: Smart people, variety of projects
cons: Sales focus, internal competition

title: ‘Fast paced learning environment,  poor effort to benefit ratio.’
pros: The challenging and fast paced environment.
cons: No work life balance no matter what they preach.

title: ‘Not bad but not good’
pros: Work/life balance is good
cons: Definitely no career progression and if they have to pay for it, forget about it.

title: ‘Work hard and be rewarded... not the average 9 - 5 office job’
pros: The brand reputation, learning and development options, amazing parental leave entitlements (18 weeks paid leave for both men and women), free yoga, free snacks, nice office.
cons: Be prepared to work hard - Deloitte expects the best and takes pride in their reputation. You won't be paid as much as your government clients.

title: ‘It was a great place to learn about how business is done at the corporate level’
pros: Tier 1 firm environment
cons: Complex client issues

title: ‘It wasn't an ideal experience.’
pros: Flexible times. Part of a global firm. Good name to have on your CV.
cons:
Bad leadership without foresight and experience.
Lack of working in harmony.

title: ‘Good for 1-2 yrs after that run!’
pros: Equal opportunity. Good for career start
cons:
Terrible management 
No work life balance

title: ‘Experienced manager’
pros: Work life balance assss
cons: Client deadlines waww

title: ‘N/a’
pros: Opportunity to experience different projects over various industries
cons: At times does not necessarily play to your strengths in the workplace

title: ‘I loved the colleagues who were supportive and respectful but unfortunately there were many who weren't and they were generally the Partners.’
pros: Worked with amazing and supportive peers.
cons: Still very much an old school hierarchical structure.

title: ‘Learnt how to cope working in a difficult work environment.’
pros: The technology available
cons:
Toxic environment. 
Poor management.
Non-existent cross-functional communication.

title: ‘Not an experience that I would recommend to anyone. ’
pros: Nothing was good except for the nice colleagues that you meet whilst working there, but they all leave too.
cons: Everything, there is nothing good about this employer.

title: ‘Many years of satisfactory employment, capped off with an extremely stressful 12 months’
pros: Opportunities to play to strengths
cons: Some businesses within the firm may be poorly led

title: ‘Long hours alongside other smart people ’
pros: Some interesting projects, rotating teams, managers tend to care about your development
cons: Promotions and pay progression are rigid, bureaucracy is a growing problem, some projects can be boring or repetitive

title: ‘Poor.’
pros: Constant training and multiple projects occurring at any time to provide broad exposure
cons: Lack of staff and poor costing for projects by management and directors to which the staff both senior and graduates are expected to work harder for no compensation to deliver the promise to the client

title: ‘Great for your next career move or congrats if you work for a partner cares about your career growth in Deloitte’
pros: Great company with lots of benefits
cons: Sometimes you have to spend times doing very low level works just for the purpose of billing customer

title: ‘Great learning in a dynamic cultural environment’
pros: Great learning & growth opportunities, possible to forge your own path into areas of interest
cons: So many opportunities that it's easy to get lost into it! Important to set personal boundaries and manage your own career / priorities

title: ‘Wonderful people and culture, let down by pay and technical retention ’
pros: People and culture.
cons: The promotion path for technical specialists doesn’t seem to keep pace with the traditional pathway.

title: ‘Most stressful time of my life. Enjoyed my team but think the firm is unethical in their expectations’
pros:
CV branding
Development opportunity 
Exposure to varied client base and leadership
Calibre of colleagues
cons:
Work life balance
Salary very low

title: ‘Not a nice experience and very rude staff except one.’
pros:
Truly and utterly boring.
The reason why I left the position. I liked to be kept busy so you aren't clock watching.
cons: What challenges. I got laid all the horrible jobs.

title: ‘CV builder not long term job’
pros: The teams you work in are full of great people. Big 4 will always look good on your cv so if you can take the shot and the hours it's worth it for at least 3 years.
cons: Work life balance. They will tell you they are great at work life balance but at the end of the day the aren't. Also the worst paid of the big 4. Compare with people who work in the others and you will quickly find out you are being paid peanuts

title: ‘Lots of opportunity, but don't expect to get rewarded.’
pros: There are lots of opportunities to move around to new areas, so if you want to branch out, this is definitely encouraged and supported.
cons: Pay is woeful. Trying to ask for industry salary is like pulling teeth, and the processes around pay are frankly draconian, encouraging people to not discuss pay so that you don't find out lateral hires are getting a lot more than you. Long-term employees get shifted around even if they can't do their job, and pointless processes persist in many areas.

title: ‘Nigjtmare’
pros: Colleagues, friday drinks
cons: Delivery without information

title: ‘Working with professional team and professional environment. ’
pros: Professional Environment
cons: Workload is very high most of the time.

title: ‘Fun place to work but the work itself was uninteresting. Pay was relatively low for Australia. ’
pros: The social aspect of working at Deloitte was like no other. I truly met so many people that I considered and still keep as friends.
cons: Being in consulting, it was difficult to find and then get placed on to a project that was really interesting and that provided a good opportunity for growth. I also felt that the people there, particularly management, ranged from excellent to very poor in their capability as leaders.

title: ‘Mixed feeling’
pros: Great learning opportunities
cons: Work culture wasn't as expected.

title: ‘You join Deloitte for the name on your CV, not the money’
pros: Different projects and industries
cons: Being sold onto projects with no experience

title: ‘Good for our career’
pros: Career development, brand name opening up more opportunities
cons: Groupism depending on the kind of people comprising the team

title: ‘Poor experience. As a lateral there is minimal investment into growth and complete disregard of work life balance.’
pros: Exposure to multiple industries and opportunities available to learn.
cons: No work life balance. Very competitive. All I could see at director and above were people with broken personal lives.

title: ‘Great organisation that adapt to clients demands and drive change’
pros: Great balance between performance and people aspect
cons: Adapt and build your internal network

title: ‘Backwards step in my career’
pros: Leaving. Poor management leaving.
cons: Working there. Poor management. Outdated systems. Lack of integration between systems. Siloed teams. Lack of opportunity to work on projects that interest you and your skill set. Lack of follow through on career goals. No real feedback from 'coaches' or peers, everyone just looking out for themselves and throwing you under the bus without a chance to recover.

title: ‘Smoke and mirrors.’
pros: You have all the technology/resources at your finger tips to do your work.
cons: You talk about work/life balance when in reality people are working 50-60 hours per week on a regular basis without being paid or acknowledged.

title: ‘Have worked for Deloitte near 2 years, have enjoyed every moment of it’
pros: Culture and work environment
cons: None at the moment, but theres alot of support from staff members which help challenges seem unnoticeable

title: ‘Exhausting ’
pros: Diverse workforce culturally
cons: Work life balance due to long working hours

title: ‘Only partners get a pay day’
pros: You can work on interesting projects
cons: A mean and greedy structure that is good for partners and no one else

title: ‘Fantastic, dynamic, fast paced and supportive experience working at Deloitte.’
pros: Positive, supportive and harmonious workplace.
cons: No challenges or difficulties.

title: ‘Follow the right team, and the right project/’
pros: Just like any consulting company, it's more important of which team (partners) you join.  And lucky for me, DPE is one of the great teams you can find.
cons: No challenge, life is too easy

title: ‘Great place to work, great people, strong brand.’
pros: Opportunities to work overseas; great people to work with; good clients and interesting projects.
cons: Like any Big 4 firm there is a need to be constantly selling yourself internally. I find this a bit draining.

title: ‘Not worthy ’
pros: The exposure to different industries
cons: Work life balance is the worst and dealing with egocentric partners and managers

title: ‘Not good but not bad either’
pros: Good offices, nice locations
cons: Bad Middle Management (Directors), Teams operate in silos as Partners run their businesses with their own culture and values which might be different from what the company stands for at an overall level

title: ‘Good learning opportunities, good culture, low pay, typical of partnership structure. ’
pros: Excellent and established flexible work practices, even for juniors.
cons: It sometimes feels as though only one kind of person can be successful.

title: ‘Disgusting ’
pros: Nothing at all was good.
cons: Terrible treatment by senior management, terrible HR department.

title: ‘Not impressed’
pros: Work with good peers
cons: Deal with incompetent management

title: ‘They treat people with a total lack of respect’
pros: None
cons: Turning up was the biggest challenge.

title: ‘A good place for a graduate or young person, but if you have a family , think it twice to work in here.’
pros: Got maternity leave for 4 months
cons: Proofing your skills with many people.

title: ‘Very difficult to thrive if you're coming in as a senior consultant.’
pros: Good learning experience with a major Big Four player.
cons: Lack of support and structure for outsiders coming into the firm with no Big Four or financial services/consultancy background.

title: ‘Good only if you want to specialise, bad for learning’
pros:
Events
You get to see how a huge organisation works
Good networking and facilities
cons:
Lack of opportunities
Limited career development to grow horizontally - boxes you in something fairly quick
Occassional toxic culture and lack of equal opportunity, unlike what they proclaim to be the "best" at.
Almost like a frat - they groom grads and treat them miles better than lateral hires, as if that's the only route the partner

title: ‘Positive you are only held back by your ability and willingness to learn’
pros: Great place to work and develop your skills in a positive and supportive environment
cons: Can be overly competitive as you progress your career

title: ‘A shallow company that talks a much better game than it plays’
pros: Interesting work at Client sites but they type of work is determined more by consultant availability than by client requirements or skills required
cons: Pay is well below par with no bonus structures in play. Expected to work significant hours in addition to client time with little to no consideration to family life.  Have not seen one discussion about staff development or client satisfaction - focus is just on sales and revenue.

title: ‘Ok but no work life balance and is stressfull’
pros: Diverse clients and learning opportunities
cons: Nil work Life balance and highly stressful

title: ‘You need to be strong for you’
pros: Lucky if you get good Partners that support you as a person and your professional development
cons: Poor people managment from practice manager, wants everyone in the same box.

title: ‘Opportunities for development but lacking in other areas ’
pros: Great opportunity for development and progression
cons:
Poor work life balance. 
Lip service to mental health. 
Average to poor salary

title: ‘Overwhelming, hard work but looks good on your resume’
pros: Good people and exposure to high profile clients
cons: Unrealistic expectations from clients and higher management.

title: ‘Some advantages but many more disadvantages’
pros: Experience looks great on Resume
cons: No work life balance whatsoever

title: ‘Average’
pros: Great work life balance
cons: Been here for about five years but have never gotten a pay rise

title: ‘Perfect place for work, family life balance’
pros: Great place and great culture
cons: Great place and great culture

title: ‘Demanding but rewarding’
pros: Potential to grow
cons: Multitasking

Staff is good

title: ‘It was a good time.’
pros: Its truly a world class organisation. You know it.
cons: Life is extremely difficult when you work in a Big 4.

title: ‘A toxic work environment, to which I have never looked back.’
pros: Colleagues in team at the same level were very skilled and good to work with.
cons: Management were not skilled, relied heavily on staff at lower levels. Staff at lower levels were not rewarded for additional effort or even recognised for good work.
